Reviews.Title: “excellent location for a short break”
Reviews.Author: ciaobellaScotland
Reviews.Content: hotel is right in the heart of the city and a perfect base for a short break. most attractions/sights within walking distance, and there is an underground station on the doorstep. staff were friendly. we were lucky to get a room overlooking the fruitmarket at the rear of the hotel, lovely aromas, and not much noise surprisingly. the room also had a private terrace with table and chairs. (there are only a few rooms with this) the rooms are not huge but are modern, clean and fresh. we did not use the restaurant, which only serves breakfast, so cannot comment. we found plenty of small cafes closeby and numerous restaurants for the evening. I would recommend getting a price from the hotel's own website, we got a better deal!

Reviews.Title: “Just what a couple need for a weekend get away!”
Reviews.Author: Einat N
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the heart of the city. Very nice, clean, friendly. Just what a couple needs for a weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant position for a fun weekend trip”
Reviews.Author: CousinHinton
Reviews.Content: This spotlessly clean beautifully furnished hotel is really central, Everywhere within walking distance . Metro just outside for slightly further places , airport and station. We stayed Thursday and Friday night in February. Fab modern clean furnishings. Nice young staff. Only snag is rooms are beautifully decorated etc but very, very small - even for Brits! No problem for a couple of nights though. Might be a bit claustrophobic for a week though! Bring your own kettle , tea and coffee as no factilities in room. We did and were glad of a refreshing cuppa. We had no meals in hotel so no idea of standard. But who would want to eat in a hotel when thrilling , fun Barcelona is just outside?

Reviews.Title: “Average, but top location (check recommendations for restaurants in text)”
Reviews.Author: Avtobus
Reviews.Content: Hotel Eurostar Ramblas Boqueria is small hotel on main street La Rambla next to Boqueria market. Hotel is average but nice. Main points: Plus: location Minus: bad smell from bathroom, no lobby (small desk reception), no bar, no... Hotel is perfect if you get good price and if you want just bed. It doesn't provide you with any additional service. Staff is friendly and helpful. Its all about location. Nothing else. Here are the main tips for Barcelona visit: Do not eat on La Rambla! Its poor and very expensive. try to find other places and here are tips from my friends from Barcelona and the y are VERY useful: You have to visit LA BOQUERIA. It is the best market (fresh food) we have in Barcelona. You have the possibility to do a "Brunch" (= breakfast and lunch) in one of the bars/restaurants you have inside. We suggest you to go to the bar called "BAR PINOCHO" (entering the main entrance of La Boquería from the street Las Ramblas, turn right or just ask anyone). Places to visit: We suggest you to go to the Tourist information Office (very close from your hotel) and ask them for the Tourist bus and suggestions. But do not forget to spend time at "The Gothic Neighborhood" (Old city). You will see the Cathedral, nice churches like L´Esglesia del Mar, Plaza del Pi, etc... Close to this last place "Plaza del pi", there is a very traditional coffee shop called "GRANJA DULCINEA" (Street Petritxol nº 2) where you can ask for a "SUIZO" (Hot Spanish style chocolate + cream). Very nice place and better food. RESTAURANTS: "MERENDERO DE LA MARI" One of our favorite restaurants for eating PAELLA, fish and seafood in Barcelona is: (to do a reservation is hardly recommended). Ask at the hotel. Phone: 93. 221 31 41 (www.merenderodelamari.com) Recommended for lunch and diner. Another very nice and traditional restaurant for fish is "CAN SOLE" (Sunday evening and Monday closed ) Carrer Sant Carles 4 (www.cansole.cat) One of the best restaurants from Galicia in Barcelona (you can have very good seafood) is "CASA DARIO" at Consell de Cent 256. Phone: 93 453 31 35 "GORRIA" If you love steaks, we recommend you this restaurant. You can taste the best Spanish ham and some specialties from the north of Spain (Navarra). It is one of the favorite restaurants of many futbol players of FC Barcelona. Street Diputacion 421 - Phone: 93 245 11 64. You have to ask for "Chuletón steak" ( check pictures). If you would like to eat some typical Tapas, we suggest you to go to: "CERVECERIA CATALANA or CIUDAD CONDAL" (both from the same owner) "CERVECERIA CATALANA": Street MALLORCA 236 (very close from the street called RAMBLA CATALUNYA). Remember this street because you are going to go up and down several times these days because is the second best shopping street. : ) "CIUDAD CONDAL" Street Rambla Catalunya 18 We went there four time. You will need to wait 20 minutes to be seated but its worth. Just go to the reception lady and ask for table. Dont wait in crowd!!! The best shopping streets are: PASSEIG DE GRACIA and RAMBLA CATALUNYA. If you are on top of Passeig de Gracia and you like to have a lunch or diner, I suggest you to go to: "RESTAURANTE TRAGALUZ" (Passatge de la Concepció 5) Phone: 93 487 06 21 http://www.grupotragaluz.com/rest-tragaluz.php If you like Japanese food (we adore Japanese food), you must go to: "KOY SHUNKA" Street Copons 7 (very close to the Cathedral). Phone: 93 412 79 39 (www.koyshunka.com) If you want pasta and risotto from Italy we suggest you to go to "DA GRECO" at Passeig de Gracia 116. You have to take into account that restaurants open at 20:30 for dinner, so if you like to have a glass of wine before going to this places, I suggest you to go to: "MON VINIC" Street Diputació 249. And if you want to have a drink after the dinner you can go to: "HOTEL OMM" at Street Roselló 265. If you want to go dancing go to: "LUZ DE GAS" Street Muntaner 246. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: MacChelmsford
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in mid-January and found that the hotel lived up to its good reviews. Friendly and helpful reception, good-sized rooms with small balconies, newly decorated with modern furnishings, comfortable beds, crisp linen and well-equipped bathrooms. Had to ask for the balcony door handle which enables the staff to warn you of the 8 to 10" step down from the room floor to the balcony! As has been mentioned in previous reviews, the hotel has very few facilities but does have a small public seating area with TV, coffee maker and newspapers. There is also a decked area with a couple of sun loungers and chairs/tables overlooking the market roof - quite nice to watch the sun set here! The principal attraction of the hotel is its central location right on the Ramblas, close to the Plaza Calalyuna and a short walk to many buildings of architectural interest. The heating/air-con is centrally controlled but can be turned off. We had a balcony door slightly open and there was a moderate amount of traffic noise - only to be expected. There was space in the fridge for our own drinks and the room was thoroughly cleaned daily with fresh bed-linen. Wi-fi was a bit patchy at times but the room lighting was good for reading. The hotel has a small breakfast room charging 10 Euros but there is better value to be had at any number of nearby cafes or at the Boqueria. Tubes stations are close by at Catalunya and Liceu.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location on La Rambla, but not quiet”
Reviews.Author: travelzomby
Reviews.Content: Location. Location. Location. We stayed here for 5 nights over the New Year's Celebration Jan 1, 2012. Our first night we had a room in front with a french door balcony overlooking the energetic La Rambla. If you want to be in the middle of the action, this is the place for you. If you want a quiet night's sleep, maybe not. We changed rooms for the rest of our trip to the back of the hotel overlooking the Boqueria Market. Quieter during the night, (unless you have noisy neighbors, which we did) but the market begins setting up around 6:30 AM and the noise begins again. (The Boqueria Market is a must see. One of the most beautiful markets I've ever seen!) **Ask for the KEY to the French Doors when you check-in. They require the key to open. The room was HOT (in January) so we had to choose the temperature or the noise from the doors being open. Beds are "European Average Boxspring Firm". No pillowtop mattresses here. As long as I don't feel the springs, lumps or excessive firm, I can deal with it. Rooms are small, but clean. Extremely average. Edgar at the front desk was fabulous! His directions and recommendations were invaluable! Breakfast offered for purchase. No gym, no room service. Phones, Wi-fi worked well. Didn't notice if they had a tv, I wasn't there to watch Spanish Television.

Reviews.Title: “Rear Room With a Deck Made the Stay”
Reviews.Author: NancyNorton
Reviews.Content: We originally were given a street-facing room on the third floor. The room itself was nice, but the key to the windows/balcony was lost, so the windows and shutters couldn't be opened. Otherwise it would have been a nice place to overlook activity on Las Ramblas. The room was much too hot for us, and the AC was off (it was November). The front desk staff was very responsive and moved us to our choice of the rooms on the first floor at the back of the hotel. They were much cooler, with French doors that opened onto very large private decks overlooking the St. Joseph's farmer's market. It was funs seeing things open up in the morning and wonderful to visit after a nice breakfast in the hotel's smallish breakfast cafe. The room was quiet and comfortable and the location very convenient to our planned visit to Paleu Guell.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, sparkling clean, friendly property on Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: charlesp
Reviews.Content: Hotel is newly decorated, clean, and in a very convenient location (if the Ramblas is what you are looking for.) It's important to note that this is not a hotel with ANY services beyond really very nice (albeit small) modern rooms with bathrooms that are equally shiny and clean. There is no gym, no room service, and in fact I think my room had no phone. I think, however, there is a breakfast room. Lastly, there is no climate control available to the guest and you will need to ask for the windows to be unlocked if you want to acheive a temperature closer to outside. Wireless was spotty but free. I know this review sounds a bit negative but I rate thsi hotel "very good" because for the right price it's a great deal and if you are only interested in really friendly establishment with a room that could easily command a far higher price in a full service "palace" you will not be disappointed. I stay here almost exclusively when I am travelling on business to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Centrally Controlled Air Conditioning though.”
Reviews.Author: Nodnoltravel
Reviews.Content: The Eurostars Ramblas Boquería hotel is centrally located on the Ramblas and a good hotel, with a Metro station just outside providing good links to the city. There a plenty of shops on your doorstep and a lively market barely a minutes’ walk away. The hotel room/bathroom was clean with modern fittings and was adequately sized for two sharing. The breakfast is charged at €10, per person per day. This really isn’t necessary considering the many other cheaper options within very close walking distance. There is also free Wi-fi. The only down side of the hotel is the air conditioning. This is bizarrely controlled centrally ! ! So every room in the hotel has the temperature set by whatever is decided by the hotel. The result is the balcony doors had to be opened to cool the room down before sleeping. This would not be an option in the summer, as the Ramblas never sleeps, and the noise would be intolerable. I assume the air conditioning would be at a suited level during the summer months. The AC unit on the wall can only be turned on or off - no temperature adjustments. The bed was slightly hard and mine was slightly lopsided. The female hotel receptionist endeavoured to cover my room request before arrival, which proves the quality of service. The hotel reception is very small, but the hotel is more than adequate for a stay. The rooms and building itself give no feeling of claustrophobia despite the small lobby. I would recommend this hotel stay for any travellers whether it’s a stag/hen weekend, couples or friends. All things considered, I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: nermacis
Reviews.Content: Rooms are newly decorated and clean in a very convenient location. At the back of the hotel it is quiet with an outlook over the market across to the mountain and chairlift. Would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: sixthgearmusic
Reviews.Content: The service was decent. The rooms were ok. The location was great! This is a small boutique hotel with a nice modern decor. Rooms were decent size. Bathrooms need some help. You have no control over the temperature in your room. It was very convenient to by the Boqueria market for breakfast in the morning. We were there for the Fiesta La Merce (thanks to the wife) which is the biggest festival of the year for Barcelona. It was great to sit on the balcony of the hotel and watch the Parade of the Gigantes down La Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: sicng
Reviews.Content: I was travelling with my parents and have booked 2 rooms. Have asked for rooms next to each other. When we arrived, we were given one room on 1 floor and the other one on 3 floor! I have no control of the tempeture of room, per receptionist is controlled by hotel. I have to sleep with window open because it was too warm ! Rooms are modern, bathroom need a little tlc, bathtub was rusted. Excellent location, mediocre service. Receptionists will give you informations when asked, not relly warm people. This is a small boutique hotel, not a big hotel. There is no reception area, just a small desk! It was not worth the price we paid, Would not recommend to my friends nor families.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Shake84
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. The staff were friendly, the rooms were modern and nicely decorated, and you could not beat the location. One tip about Las Ramblas though is that the restaurants on that street are a rip off. We went to one that had an offer for a main dish and an appetizer for a decent price, and were shocked when the bill came and found that the drinks (a coke and a juice) were not included in the offer price and cost more than the food! Also, be sure to check out the market right next to the hotel. The colors are amazing that you can't help but take pictures of the food. And try some of the fresh juices there while you are at it (the pina colada was my favourite).

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: PhilParker12
Reviews.Content: Awesome place to stay in Barcelona. Amazing location, makes it good value for money. Overlooks La Ramblas, right in front of the St Josep Boqueria. 20 minute walk to the beach. Service was average - our tv didn't work and after asking them three times to fix it they still never did (not that we wanted to watch tv but it would have been nice to have had some assistance).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great stay - highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: LadyPerth85
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Eurostars Ramblas Boqueria in September 2009 where my hubby and I had a wonderful stay. The hotel is conveniently located in central Barcelona on La Ramblas, virtually next to the Mercat St. Josep. A short walk away from the Maremagnum by the sea and also in close proximity to the metro to get to Parc Guell, La Sagrada Familia...etc. The reception staff were friendly and helpful - no fuss check in. The rooms were very modern, spacious and clean. All necessary facilities provided (hairdryer, adequate towels, toiletries, flat screen tv, wi-fi..etc). There was no ironing facilities provided but there was a laundry service available to hotel guests. My only gripe is that when we left a pair of pants to be laundered in a laundry bag with the appropriate request form first thing in the morning, we came back to find that it had not been collected. I would otherwise definitely return to stay again! Bedding was very comfortable and gave for a good night's sleep. Great value for what you pay!

Reviews.Title: “Located in the heart of Las Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: PlannerM27
Reviews.Content: It's so hard to find a hotel online that you think you'll like. Eurostars Las Ramblas Boqueria worked beautifully. This is a small hotel, which, for us, offered personal service. This started shortly after making our reservation. I had emailed a few questions and received quick a quick reply. We had a small problem w the bathroom toilet which was fixed very quickly. The rooms are on the modern side but now that I see it in person it isn't as bad as it seemed online. I prefer cozy rooms. Our room faced Las Ramblas, which was fine. Yes on some nites people outside were louder than other nites, depending on what the street entertainment was. If you want zero chance of hearing the nite life, than ask for a room that overlooks the market in back. You'll have NO view but it will be quiet. The room temperature is elecctronically controlled for the hotel. This means that individual rooms don't have control. It has been very warm outside but pleasantly cool in the room. Breakfast is available in the hotel. The only complaint we had was that they don't stock washcloths. This was pretty minor as we just used a hand towel. We're pretty easy going and flexible people, which I feel is important when traveling abroad. Oh, there is a fridge in the room. It's pretty well stocked but great for your water. The front door staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. All in all an enjoyable trip. PS, don't buy anything, food or trinkets, right on Las Ramblas. It's a great street to people watch, window shop, and take in the atmosphere but you'll pay twice as much for anything that you would off the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff,”
Reviews.Author: globetrotter_BRA
Reviews.Content: My boyfried and I stayed at this hotel on the first week of September and we had a lovely time: As soon as we arrived, we met Mila at the reception, which was very helpful to help us leaving our luggages at the reception cloackroom before the 2pm check - in, which was 4 hours away, and as requested, she managed to find a room at the first floor with a big balcony facing the Boquería Market. When we checked-in the room, we found a nice, clean, modern and cozy room; even though reading all the reviews about the noise in the streets- yes, it is noisy- It's nothing impossible to make you have a nice night sleep, as the bed/pillows, double glazing and shades do their job.. In the early mornings you could hear the noise from the market, specialy a guy screaming a non-stop "colores!colores!!" selling colorfull necklaces, but as we did, once we woke up, went straight to the beach. The guys at the reception were all VERY helpfull: Mila, Santiago and Israel didn't hesitate to help in any circumstances, advises or odd requests and I am very grateful for this. The localisation of this hotel couldn't be better: right in the heart of Las Ramblas, 2 min away from the Gothic Barrio and a pleasant 15 min away ciclying to the beach (we never used the tube as we rent bikes, a brilliant option as Barcelona is flat and bike friendly, but if your are not in to bikes, tube station is right on front of the hotel). We didn't try the breakfast as we loved to go out and try different bocadillos every day from the cafes nearby; also in the Boquería Market which is behind the hotel, has delicious options: tapas, bocadillos, fresh fruits, cavas, smoothies and so on... Would deffinitelly be back, and reccomend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place - this will be our go to Barcelona hotel.”
Reviews.Author: winequaffer
Reviews.Content: This place was fantastic from both a location and property perspective. As we are increasingly finding ... beware of reviews from those with only 1 or 2 contributions!! We found no issues that had been complained about previously. The staff at the front desk were outstanding and very helpful. The room was as quiet as could be given we overlooked Ramblas. The room was compact but modern. The internet worked flawlessly which is refreshing for Europe. Be sure to pass on their breakfast plan some days and walk into the Boqueria... market immediately behind... absolutely a fantastic market for fresh juice, coffee, tapas, pastries, soo much fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for a sight seeing trip to Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: juliette M
Reviews.Content: Great location, very close to metro and various bus routes. The hotel is situated on La Ramblas which is constantly busy from mid morning until the early hours and is therefore noisy - this was not an issue for us even though our rooms where situated at the front of the hotel - we had 3 rooms and our ages range from 17 to 72 years and we all got good nights sleep. All the rooms have air conditioning and are very clean. The staff were very friendly and helpful - the majority of them speak fluent English. The breakfast was very nice and plentiful although if you choose not to have breakfast at the hotel there are plenty of places to get breakfast. The restaurants immediately around the hotel are not brilliant and the one opposite is awful - do not go there! Equally the market is an experience not to be missed but Carreforre along the road sells the same things for a fraction of the price. My mum brought cherries of the market and was charged 22 euros for them! The metro service is very good and the sightseeing bus is a great way to see all the sights. The hotel's position means that if you have the energy you can walk to lots of tourist sights. You do need to watch your bags around the major tourist areas and although we had no problems ourselves we did witness 2 bag snatches. If you are coming to the hotel from the airport I would recommend using the airport bus as it drops you just a few mins walk from the hotel. The hotel was a little difficult to find - it is next to the market and has a sign just saying 'hotel' on the outside. I would recommend this hotel for a stay in Barcelona - it is reasonably priced, very clean and in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and reccomend to anyone”
Reviews.Author: jacobine31
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel on the ramblas. receptionpeople are very helpfull. You can have coffee/water and muffins ed. for free. The decoration is modern/design, very nice. The room is not large but big enough; You are only there to sleep! We didn't have breakfest because you can have breakfest everywhere in barcelona, bur the room looked nice

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: RGBrooker
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, modern, and on the Ramblas. If you want to see the Ramblas, step outside the front door, and there it is. It only a short walk to Cataluyna Place. The staff were extremely nice. Our room was not on the Ramblas side. Rooms on the Ramblas side might be noisy, but our room was quiet. The Metro stop is only about 50-100 yards away. There is a taxi stand about 20 yards away. A cyber cafe is across the street. If you want a hotel near the tourist sites, this is it. If you want a hotel away from the tourists, don't go to this one.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms, poor service.”
Reviews.Author: Knask
Reviews.Content: Had a good stay here recently. The rooms are modern and smart, although small and in lack of some equipment. The location is immaculate and the level of noice is low, considering that you are staying on the main street in Barcelona (we had our room facing the Boqueria market). Good housekeeping (every day) and effective air-conditioning. The biggest down-side is some of the receptionist's obvious lack of interest in giving the guests the best possible service. Unfriendly staff is easier to detect when the lobby is as small as it is here. Refusing to greet entering guests is not very service-minded.

Reviews.Title: “Look away and choose another hotel”
Reviews.Author: CleaningBoy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 1 week and wish I would have choosen another hotel. This hotel was not worth spending on average $200 per night for an entire week. It is true that this is a small botique hotel, but this small botique hotel has many problems for being so small. When I booked this hotel I did so because of the following factors: free wi-fi, location, air conditioning and the Eurostar name. The wi-fi was on and off, the reception was good at times and other times it would not pick up a signal so I would have to go on their breakfast floor to sit down and do some work. The location is great as it is in the middle of the Rambla. My biggest problem was with the air conditioning. The hotel says that they have air conditioning, but the room was so hot. I complained to the front desk and they said that because they are between seasons the air has not been turned on in the hotel, but please note that the air was on in the lobby of the hotel. I told him that I was unable to stay there like that and he offered to give me a key handle to open the window to get cooler air into the room. Well I did not get the handle to open the window until I told the agent that I am going to request a lower rate or switch hotels as I could not stay in a hot hotel room. Once the window was open I did get fresh cool air, but the noise level from outside was so loud and it was loud 24/7. Thank goodness I brought ear plugs from reading another review here that this area is loud. The last day the air conditioning was finally turned on as I guess too many people complained as the inside temperature on the thermostat was in the high 70s once you convert it over. Well when they finally did turn on the air conditioning the temperature was in the mid 60s, which was way too cold. I definately would not choose this hotel. Please double check the hotel as you want to have an air conditioner that you can control and one that is not centrally controlled where you cannot change the temperature. The rooms are very small, but decorated very tastefully. My last day there the housekeeper did clean the room, but not my bathroom. I did not complain as I work as a Director of Housekeeping for a Chicago hotel and did not want to get anyone in trouble.

Reviews.Title: “ok place, great location, probably won't stick with Eurostars brand”
Reviews.Author: HomeAwayFromHome2
Reviews.Content: Hotel facilities lovely-- clean modern room, nice view of La Rambla (right on the street), noise not a problem but we're used to big cities. Staff was friendly and professional but not particularly helpful and they seemed bound by corporate rules (for example, they wouldn't let us use their computer to check in online for our flight or print a boarding pass, saying it was against company policy). Wireless was available on the mezzanine floor but not in the rooms, and it was pretty slow. Also, we asked if they could help us book a room in another Eurostars in Spain and they were not able to, again citing corporate policy. Great location though, about a 3 minute walk from Plaza Catalunya and central to everything a Barcelona visitor would want to see. Directly adjacent to famous Bocqueria market.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain Basement Prices for 4* Service, Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: BilkoDisco
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Right on La Rambla, really friendly, lush room with a huge terrace overlooking the Boqueria market and free coffee and croissants so don't pay for the breakfast! Check in was really good. Sergio was lovely. Room was small, but prefectly formed with a big comfy bed and lush terrace (Room 101). Shower was a little sketchy (running hot/cold intermittently), but other than that it was spotless. There's no room service, or menu's in the rooms I don't think, but we wanted a crash pad to base whilst we explored and this fitted the bill perfectly. TV was random, but watched a couple of B movies on Canal+ which were funny (in an ironic kinda way). Perfect location in the middle of La Rambla and on the Uber cool Boqueira market so you can get fresh supplies for the rooms and not have to pay the rather rediculous mini-bar rates. We paid less then £60 a night on ave for 3 nights through Expedia/Tripadvisor too. Oh, and free Wi-Fi... All gravy baby!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for a good price”
Reviews.Author: anniemayence
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located on the Rambla at the corner of the Bosqueria market. We have been lucky enough to have a room on the first floor with a large terrace (2 chairs + one table). The room was small (as well as the price) but clean and well furnished. We were at the back and it was not noisy.

Reviews.Title: “basic hotel, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Shamrock75
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights, location is perfect, hotel is very basic but nice and clean, people at front desk very kind: basically what I was looking for since I use hotel only for sleeping I don't need particular services. Rates are neither too cheap nor too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: Justisss84
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel just in the heart of the La Rambla street, few meters from the underground station Liceu. Although the location is very noisy in the hotel it's very quiet. The only disadvantage was that we couldn't open the window because it was blocked. The room was very clean, every day new towels. Open 24h so you could enjoy night life. I strongly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Wayyyyyyyyyyyyyy too noisy!”
Reviews.Author: JGF75
Reviews.Content: The hotel's great location comes with pros and cons. I'll start with the latter because other reviewers seem to have captured all the good points. Well, as evidenced by the title of my review, do not stay here if you want a good night's sleep. I am admittedly a light sleeper but my fiancee is the total opposite and she could not sleep a wink either. We had a corner room, with one side facing Las Ramblas and the other overlooking the market. I identified this as a problem as soon as we checked in but reception assured me that noise would not be a problem due to the double-paned glass. I don't think a 6 foot thick concrete wall could keep the noise out of this room. Cars would roar by non-stop, as would emergency response vehicles with their sirens blasting. On top of that was the seemingly never-ending buzz from people talking and partying. Fantastic if that is what you are looking for but awful if you want some rest after a long flight. Overall, the room was quite nice, in-room safe, flat-panel tv. The room was on the smaller side but quite comfortable, except for the roach that came to visit. The bathroom was elegantly appointed, marble everywhere but once again, I do have a complaint. The shower leaked everywhere. As you have probably read, the location is fantastic for touring. Right beside the market, walking distance to the subway, hop-on/hop-off buses, the gothic quarter etc. There is also a grocery store nearby (Carrefour) where you can buy things much, much cheaper than at the hotels. Overall, I would not recommend staying here, mostly because I found better value (see my review of Torre Catalunya, which should be posted soon).

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: mirajavora
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in the hotel just a few months after it opened. It had an overall modern feel and rooms with brand new furnishing and equipment. The location is excellent although it comes with a downside - noise either from Ramblas in the evening or the market in the morning. The breakfast was very average as was the overall service. The size of the rooms isn't very big either and it may therefore seem a bit pricy. Despite that I would consider staying in the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location, great price, perfect sense of Spain”
Reviews.Author: nikki_eatworld
Reviews.Content: Eurostars hotels are great value and nice quality. The best part is that this hotel is in a perfect location.. right on Las Ramblas next door to the Boqueria market. You may think that the noise level can be a problem, but we didn't hear anything at all. Try to stay on the top floor if you can. The hotel is pretty secured and even though they lock the front door at night, there's always someone to buzz you in. The staff could have been better at recommending places but it's no big deal because my husband and I ended up walking through small side streets and explored them ourselves. You are in the center and it's very easy to get to anywhere. The nearest Metro stop is only about 50 ft away. Since you're surrounded by restaurants and food options, you really don't need to eat breakfast at the hotel. Don't eat at restaurants on Las Ramblas though because I think they are not so good. Breakfast is fine. We actually found this restaurant called Ra right behind the hotel after walking around. The food was awesome.. and quite inexpensive. We called housekeeping once to take care of the locked balcony door (you have to get a handle from the front desk) and they came right away. Wifi is free with password provided at the front desk. No problem whatsoever. I would definitely stay at Eurostars Ramblas again if and when I visit Barcelona in the future. BTW, you can get the best jamon iberico sandwich down the street from this dinner called Vienna. The most delicious sandwich ever!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! I'd Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: Seeker707
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was simply fantastic! The location is amazing, the staff speak perfect English. We had a balcony, which we fully utilized at siesta with a few cans of beer. Beautiful. Clean. Modern. The beds were comfortable and the blackout/siesta curtains are perfect! Walk out onto Las Ramblas and join the action. Walk to the Mercado. Take a metro to and from the train station. (It's right outside!) PERFECT. And for that price? A great deal. Def check it out if you're going to Barcelona and want to stay in the center of the city!

Reviews.Title: “great place and know will go back”
Reviews.Author: lafeamasbella
Reviews.Content: The Ramblas Boqueria was a great location for me. Located in front is the tube or you can walk down to Placa Catalunya for the other stop which connects to almost all lines of the tube. Many places to have a taste of the spanish tapas, but a definite is the Boqueria (the marketplace). The room I had gave me a view to look at the Rambla, this offered a fridge inside which let me store some of my goodies I bought at the Boqueria. The one thing I really loved was that it almost has a saving energy feel, when you enter the room- there is a slot to put your room key in- this allows you to turn on the lights and tv, plus knowing you didn't lose your key if you placed it down. Rooms are going to be small, since this is the European standard but I knew what to expect and loved what this hotel offered me. Very Clean and will be definitely going back and also recommending this for my business clients to stay at. Some people said that there was a lot of noise, but for me I really didn't hear as much since I'm used to a city that has noise!

Reviews.Title: “Well-Kept Secret in Las Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: QueenTofu
Reviews.Content: If you want to see the action of Barcelona, this is it! You will find thousands of people on the street in front of this hotel. The hotel is conviently located next to Dunkin Doughnut, the opera house, the famous farmers market/ Boqueira, taxi cab stop, and not too far from a Hop On and Hop Off stop. It's really in the middle of tourist land. The hotel room was extremely modern and clean. We loved it the minute we opened the door and notice that our french doors opened to the Las Ramblas. We knew we were not in California. It is meant for couples..not families. They had a safe. We put all of our treasures in it while we were traveling in the BIG B. Plenty of pick pocketing going on, in the streets. When you get out of the hotel...to your right, there is a fabulous bakery several steps away. The crowd gets bigger beginning at 10:30 and ends around 3 a.m. You will not hear it. The English speaking gentlemen behind the desk recommended a tapa restaurant to try. It was located next to Picasso Museum. It was great. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay to explore the gothic quarter of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Trousers99
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for three nights in May to celebrate our wedding anniversary. This is a nice modern hotel, which offers clean, comfortable (but small) rooms right on the Ramblas. Breakfast was very good but basic and there are no other amenities in the hotel. The location really is superb though as you are literally just a few metres away from the most interesting part of the city as well as being within easy walking distance of the port.

Reviews.Title: “well situated but poor value for price”
Reviews.Author: sammymalagaspain
Reviews.Content: Well situated for tourist sights, right on Las Ramblas. Our room was small, fairly quiet, modern and clean except for previous clients´remains of food left in fridge and room was not cleaned at all one day.Wardrobe small and no drawers anywhere. Bathroom good but no shelf space poor towels and toilet paper.Reception staff very helpful, especially when I was pickpocketed in the market and lost all my documentation etc.No bar nor restaurant, breakfast buffet was poor selection, poor value for cost and almost impossible to get to the coffee machine and the toaster due to the layout. The TV did´nt work according to the instructions and only two english stations. We would not recommend this hotel, mainly on price.

Reviews.Title: “Only the basics here.”
Reviews.Author: Snoopy523
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel based on all of the positive reviews here, however, I must disagree. Positives: 1) The location couldn't get much better and is a perfect home base for the city. 2) We were fortunate enough to have a private deck overlooking the market. 3) Wireless access Negatives: 1) There are no services, the workers do not help with luggage. They are not even familiar with the area and are not able to make restaurant recommendations or even give directions. 2) Cleaning staff does not thoroughly clean, and they don't even look outside on the patio to see if table/chairs need cleaning. 3) One of the worst showers I have ever experienced, it is basically a handheld wand that is supposed to remain suspended above if you'd like a traditional shower experience, however, it is faulty and the wand fell and hit my head while showering - this also happened to my husband. It is also very loud from the street noise, this doesn't bother me but may be a concern to others.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: Sof_gr
Reviews.Content: I really don't know why people write so many good reviews about this hotel. The good thing about it, it's that it right on the Rambla and if you're lucky enough, you might be given a room with a front view on the Rambla. Other than that, i have many doubts about the cleanliness of the hotel. We stayed there last week, having booked 2 rooms, for 6 days and not once had they changed our sheets or wiped the floor. The towels have a strange smell, and i suppose it was the only thing changed regularly. I think it's unacceptable for a 3* hotel, not to change sheets at all, for a 6 day stay. The breakfast room is tiny and serves the guests from 7pm to 10 pm. We asked for butter at 9.50 pm and the waitress, obviously unhelpful, said it was finished. (!) The other day we asked for cheese and she said the same thing. Then, tha lady from the reception desk came upstairs to the breakfast room and they had some kind of an argument i guess, because she wasn't serving the guests. The staff at the reception is quite helpfull, but they are clueless about the the city and what to do where. They all replied the same thing, when asked for info. ''I'm not from here''. Overall, i would definitelly not stay there again and since this was my third time in Barcelona, next time i will prefer booking in another area, Born for instance, instead of the noisy and dirty Ramblas. Believe me, Barcelona has much more many attractive places to see and stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location, Beautiful Modern Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: DebSilverSpring
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated right in the heart of La Ramblas and above/next to the open market, St. Josep's. The building has a classic exterior with awesome french-style doors that open onto the balconies and the interior is sleek & modern. It was quiet and peaceful inside but you could open the doors to garner the excitement from outside. Staff was excellent - made great recommendations and were very accommodating. Would stay here again in a heartbeat and will look for Eurostars hotels wherever I travel...

Reviews.Title: “Interesting”
Reviews.Author: scienceguy100
Reviews.Content: This place is certainly in excellent condition. The staff is very nice and the hotel is new and very clean. The location is very interesting though. Im sure you have heard of Las Ramblas, and it surely is very busy. The hotel is next door to the market and that is very busy too. Although I disagree with others, it is perfectly safe in my opinion. I went outside at 1 and 2 in the morning and there were many people with luggage even. Of course at that time, you will have to tolerate a few working girls. However, I will have to agree with others on the point of the sound issues. It is understandably loud at night as people stumble from the bars and then promptly at 6am when the market starts. That is of course if the faint low frequency rumbling metro doesnt wake you up first.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: GregHenry
Reviews.Content: We were in Barcelona for 2 nights in route from Madrid to Begur on the Costa Brava. We were on the first (actually, the third) floor, our two teenagers were in the front, we were in the back. We had a nice terrace overlooking the market. Our room was quiet with a big bed, our kid's room had two twins and was a little louder with the noise from the street. There's a check-in desk on the first floor, lobby on the second floor and a small dining room that serves a breakfast for an extra fee. No pool. We liked the hotel for location, the terrace, and wi-fi. The decorating was modern but not particularly warm and comfy. I like warm and comfy. Nice bathroom. Lots of marble, chrome. The rates were pretty good and the location was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location , small rooms and quite noisy”
Reviews.Author: Huttiheita
Reviews.Content: Cant beat the location. Everything is close and when you got to much to carry, just swing by your hotel to drop off some bags and maybe take 5 minutes in your air conditioned room. Reasonable priced for this location, but be prepared to go out of the room to change opinion. The rooms was really really small. The good things: Location, the view directly to las ramblas, fun to look at all the people going by. You could use air con even without room key, so it was nice and cold when you got back. Free internet. The bad things: The bed was hard as a stone , the room was really small , the noise was quite heavy at the night, hard to sleep. All in all a mediocre hotel with a good location, but i wouldnt stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Eurostars Ramblas Boqueria
HotelInfo.Address: Rambla de Sant Josep 91 - 93, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
